solution_line_template: First find how fast each runs. Apple = {race_distance} miles / {apple_speed} miles per hour = <<{race_distance}/{apple_speed}={apple_time_hours}>>{apple_time_hours} hours
Mac = {race_distance} miles / {mac_speed} miles per hour = <<{race_distance}/{mac_speed}={mac_time_hours}>>{mac_time_hours} hours.
Mac runs {apple_time_hours} hours - {mac_time_hours} hours = <<{apple_time_hours}-{mac_time_hours}={time_difference_hours}>>{time_difference_hours} hours faster.

1 hour = {minutes_per_hour} minutes, so, Mac runs faster by {time_difference_hours} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes = <<{time_difference_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={time_difference_minutes}>>{time_difference_minutes} minutes.
